content: वश {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [वश् कर्तरि अच् भावे अप् वा] {@--1@} Subject to, influenced by, under the influence or control of, usually in <ab>comp.</ab>; शोकवशः, मृत्युवशः &c. {@--2@} Obedient, submissive, compliant. {@--3@} Humbled, tamed. {@--4@} Charmed, fascinated. {@--5@} Subdued by charms. --शः, --शं {@--1@} Wish, desire, will. {@--2@} Power, influence, control, mastership, authority, subjection, submission; स्ववश ‘subject to oneself’, independent; परवश ‘under the influence of others’; अनयत् प्रभुशक्तिसंपदा वशमेको नृपतीननंतरान् <ls>R. 8. 19</ls>; वशं नी, or आनी to reduce to subjection, subdue, win over; वशं गम्-इ-या &c. to become subject to, give way, yield, submit; न शुचो वशं वशिनामुत्तम गंतुमर्हसि <ls>R. 8. 90</ls>; वशे कृ or वशीकृ to subdue, overcome, win over; to fascinate, be-witch. वशात् (<ab>abl.</ab>) is frequently used adverbially in the sense of ‘through the force, power or influence of’, ‘on account of’, ‘for the purpose of’; दैववशात्, वायुवशात्, कायर्वशात् &c. {@--3@} Being tamed. {@--4@} Birth. --शः The residence of harlots.
